factText: An economic consulting firm says Hurricane Florence may result in between $17 billion and $22 billion in lost economic output and property damage. factText: Please read and share the post below from the South Carolina Emergency Management Division regarding volunteering to help with the recovery from Hurricane Florence, as well as how to donate to those i. factText: The U.S. Coast Guard conducted welfare checks today on one of North Carolina's hardest hit areas after Hurricane Florence moved through the Carolinas. factText: Here’s a list of trusted disaster relief organizations responding to Hurricane Florence to consider donating to:. UPDATED (Sept. 17, 3:00 p.m. MT) Samaritan’s Purse Canada is responding in Jesus’ Name after Hurricane Florence, which packed powerful 170-km/hr winds, tore through the southeastern U.S, driving tens . We’re supporting first responders in the wake of #HurricaneFlorence, and you can help! Read more to find out how. bit.ly/United2Gether

factText: The weather channel and CNN both reporting Russian interference during rescue efforts! Praying for those dealing with hurricane Florence. OLYMPIA — The 2018 hurricane season has brought a devastating blow to residents of North and South Carolina with the arrival of Hurricane Florence. Washingtonians are reaching out to help
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_What news outlets are reporting on {event} and what are they saying?

factText: In the aftermath of Hurricane Florence, rivers are expected to continue flooding throughout North Carolina. Some rivers still hadn’t peaked by Monday. Generals expect worst flooding to occur late this week. Their top concern remains the Wilmington area. Hurricane Florence has flooded entire towns in North Carolina and its not over yet. A line of powerful storms caused flooding, downed trees and power lines and spawned several funnel clouds in Henrico Monday afternoon.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q043

factText: Coastal & marine wildlife refuges are absorbing excess waters from Hurricane Florence.

factText: The Disaster Distress Helpline can provide immediate counseling to anyone who wants help dealing with ongoing effects of the Hurricane Florence. Call 1-800-985-5990 http://bit.ly/2jQqdCN. CALL NOW! 419.725.1600! We've got members of the Red Cross here taking YOUR donations to help the victims of #HurricaneFlorence 419.725.1600
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_What emergency numbers should people call for help during {event}?
